name: large-file-warning
description: Warns when a file being written exceeds 500 lines, suggesting it may need splitting.

hooks.command: bash -c 'INPUT=$(cat); CONTENT=$(echo "$INPUT" | jq -r ".content // empty"); if [[ -n "$CONTENT" ]]; then LINES=$(echo "$CONTENT" | wc -l | tr -d " "); if [[ $LINES -gt 500 ]]; then FILE=$(echo "$INPUT" | jq -r ".file_path // empty"); echo "WARNING: $FILE is $LINES lines. Files over 500 lines may benefit from being split into smaller modules." >&2; fi; fi'
